title: [Self-Directed] Acoustic Metamaterial Sound Absorber Design: Mathematical Modeling and Deep Learning Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physics, calculus, matrix operations, and Python programming comprehension
context.additional_context: Project-based learning where learners understand acoustic metamaterial design principles through mathematical approaches and apply deep learning-based structural optimization methods

learning_goals: Acquisition of mathematical modeling skills for metamaterial sound absorbers based on acoustic wave equations.
Design of Fibonacci sequence-based resonant structures and explanation of multi-resonance peak coupling principles.

Within 6 months, learners will implement a multi-layer perceptron (MLP) model with ≥3 layers using Python and TensorFlow/Keras, achieve sound absorption coefficient prediction accuracy with RMSE ≤0.15, and validate model performance via 5-fold cross-validation.

Within 6 months, learners will design structural parameter optimization processes for ≥3 industrial design problems using reverse-engineered neural networks (Tandem NN) and produce reports quantitatively proving ≥15% performance improvement over existing solutions.
Completion of a two-stage resonance unit design project to achieve over 80% sound absorption efficiency in the 300–800 Hz band.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
